channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #78 - Heads in the Cloud
item.description: Howdie, Yanick speaking here. Gabor is out on a well-deserved vacation, and left me the keys of the PerlWeekly. The fool.

item.title: headgrep : keep the head, and grep the rest
item.description: joris joris presents us a small utility script mashing the functionality of the venerable 'head' and 'grep' tools together.

item.title: Galileo 0.012 released!
item.description: A new CMS system hits the shelves, Joel Berger announces. Galileo is very simple, and very pretty. But don't take my word for it, give it a whirl!

item.title: Lock::File - yet another file locking module
item.description: A new file locking module enters the CPAN fray: Vyacheslav Matyukhin's Lock::File.

item.title: Ask not what your user can do for you...
item.description: Toby Inkster introduces 'Ask', a new module that does its darnedest to interact with the user. No interactive prompt? I'll try to use Tk, Wx, Gtk2 or even zenity widgets to get its questions across. And it's meant to be easily extended, so that if everything else fails, you can still write your own ESP plugin.

item.title: CloudPAN
item.description: Here comes some serious competition for Acme::Magic::Pony. Nicholas Perez introduces CloudPAN, which makes installing (pure perl) modules on local machines a thing of the past.

item.title: Worth a Consideration
item.description: The aftermaths of Stevan Little's talk at the Orlando Perl Workshop continue to be felt. Here, it's John Napiorkowski's turn to muse on what was said, and what it means for the future.

item.title: Encouraging newcomers to stick with Perl
item.description: With the "Perl's a Dead-End" wails still ringing in our ears, Adam Taylor muses what we have to offer to attract new blood, beside echo chambers filled with zombies. And raptors.

item.title: Running a Mojolicious non-lite app on a cPanel VPS server
item.description: If you want to do it, Rob Hammond provides instructions how to make it happen.

item.title: Dancer Goes Megasplat
item.description: Yanick re-heats some Perl Advent leftovers and revisits the Dancer megasplat operator.

item.title: Where is your HEAD?
item.description: I tell you HTTP requests and you immediatly think GET and POST, and perhaps PUT, DELETE and all the rest of the REST gang. But what about poor HEAD? Sebastian reminds us about these oft-forgotten requests.

item.title: How can I install all favorited distributions from CPAN?
item.description: Straight-up question, to which tokuhirom provides a straight-up answer.

item.title: Wrapping Existing Code without Anonymous Functions
item.description: Anonymous functions are a handy way to wrap code, but hardly the only one. chromatic shows us one of the alternatives.

item.title: Perl 5 Core Maintenance Fund Status
item.description: Interested in the financial details of the Perl Foundation? Dan Wright has the numbers for you.

item.title: A quick JVM backend update
item.description: Wherein a NQP frontend is plugged into a QAST to JVM backend. Which is a good thing. ... I think.
